dct_title_s: Introduction a la geographie, de la corespondance du globe terrestre ou mappe-monde avec la sphere celeste par les cercles, les lignes, et les points
dct_description_sm: California shown as an unlabeled island with an idented northern coast and small islands on either side. The area above to the west is not mapped. New Zealand, Australia, and Antartica are not shown
Map shows only continent names, but no area borders or place names.
Depicted on hemispheres are meridians, parallels, and climate zones.
Includes text in french at top and bottom. Includes a decorative crest in the center between hemispheres, 3 small armillary spheres with explanatory text and 2 small wind charts at bottom.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
